title: Please help identify this font.
content:
[http://myfonts-wtf.s3.amazonaws.com/3b/3bb7c163254670ada0b0f632f75faa7c.43913.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130430112506/http:/myfonts-wtf.s3.amazonaws.com/3b/3bb7c163254670ada0b0f632f75faa7c.43913.png)

The closest font to my observation is Gotham rounded...  
Please help me identify the right font.
author: niinue

comments.content: Hard to say, very generic and neutral, not too much distinctive letters and even adding /W and /R to the glyph set (from [this page](http://web.archive.org/web/20130430112506/http:/landingpage.maxon.net/))... Gotham Rounded is actually a good alternative. I've also found [Novecento](http://web.archive.org/web/20130430112506/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/synthview/novecento) (very close but not rounded), [Houschka Alternate](http://web.archive.org/web/20130430112506/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/g-type/houschka-alt-pro) (/W and /R off), [Solomon Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20130430112506/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/font-fabric/solomon-sans), [Gabriel Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20130430112506/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/font-fabric/gabriel-sans) (as many [FontFabric](http://web.archive.org/web/20130430112506/http:/fontfabric.com/category/all-fonts) fonts actually).
